poem:
Title: "Ant Salvation's Spectral Dance"

Sonnets for the pestilence,
Writhing in red abstraction.
A Senate speaks, yet ants,
In brazen sunbaked dance,
Persist.
The government's dreamt eradication -
A farce in dusty vexation,
Urgently undulates for salvation.
A program born from desperation,
Australia's fiery insinuation,
Betrays man's jurisdiction,
Blooming in cruel contradiction.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Australian program to eradicate red fire ants is a ‘shambles’, Senate inquiry told A Senate inquiry into the spread of fire ants in Australia has heard that the government program tasked with their elimination is an “absolute shambles” and that an independent eradication body is urgently needed. The highly invasive insect is believed to have entered Australia in the 1990s and was discovered at Brisbane port in 2001. A program spanning state, territory and federal". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
